TopicTitle: Re: Wiki: keep things serperate or not?

Articles.Content:
I actually have an account on the KSP wiki, and I may start to work on it. Currently, I have a few questions:

1) In terms of parts, especially Stock and DLC, Should we go with the current scheme (absolute segregated), or employed the unified approach as typical in games with DLC (eg: https://battlefield.fandom.com/wiki/Template:Weapons/BF1)? [I personally prefer the latter approach]

2) Should we actually maintain a seperate section for "legacy parts": that is, parts that are depreciated and replaced with a completely different part name? Right now there are no consistency, with those in 1.4 being seperated, but those in 1.5/1.6 combined.

Edited March 4, 2019 by Jestersage

48 minutes ago, Nona said:

keep it separate. it might work smoothly.

For which section, question 1 or question 2?
Moved to Kerbal Network, as this is specifically about the wiki and not the game itself.
